question: @marley what is ransomware?
contexts: You should analyze the extent of the system encryption. Start the investigation by examining the infected station.

Ransomware is a type of malware from cryptovirology that threatens to publish the victim's data or perpetually block access to it unless a ransom is paid. Petya aimed to infect the master boot record, installing a payload which encrypts the file tables of the NTFS file system the next time that the infected system boots, blocking the system from booting into Windows at all until the ransom is paid. A master boot record (MBR) is a special type of boot sector at the very beginning of partitioned computer mass storage devices like fixed disks or removable drives intended for use with IBM PC-compatible systems and beyond.

Locate file the encryption PowerShell script. Analyzing last created or modified files on the client within the attack timeline reveals the actual PowerShell encryption script. The path of the script is C:\Users\User055\AppData\Local\Temp\fc8b16.ps1
